intro: Spennera ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty spennera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
